p:
We undertook phylogenetic analyses using Beast 1.10.4 software, with time-stamping based on the sampling dates of viral sequences; parameters used are listed in the appendix (pp 1–2).
18 We applied discrete phylogeographic diffusion models to the full dataset of viral strains to identify signs of geographical migration after the establishment of viral phylogenetic lineages, as has been previously published.
19 We undertook analyses and visualisations of the geographical association of phylogenetic lineages and the geographical diffusion process using SpreaD3,
20 and we used RDP version 4.95 for recombination analyses.
21 To study viral transmission dynamics, we did an analysis of reproductive number on a curated dataset of Arabian viral genome sequences listed in the appendix (pp 7–9). This analysis involved Bayesian birth death skyline analyses in Beast2,
22 using previous assumptions of parameters in accordance with the methods of Dudas and colleagues (full details are in the appendix [pp 1–3]).
23 We repeated our phylogenetic analysis to determine the robustness of our model.
